title: 'You know that's not normal, right?': Inside the rise of Pete Crow-Armstrong, MLB's next superstar
content: From flag football to Wrigley Field, PCA has been turning heads with his talent, energy and personality since he was a kid.

title: Sources: Udoka joins tier of top-paid coaches
content: Rockets coach Ime Udoka has agreed to a long-term contract extension that makes him one of the highest-paid coaches in the NBA, sources told ESPN.

title: 'New chapter': Ex-Jets, Ravens LB Mosley retires
content: Former Jets and Ravens linebacker C.J. Mosley has retired, saying in a social media post that "it's time to start a new chapter with new dreams."

title: Chiefs top pick Simmons to be full-go for camp
content: Chiefs first-round draft pick Josh Simmons will be ready to go when training camp begins after having surgery for a torn patellar injury last season at Ohio State, Andy Reid said Thursday.

title: Sources: Draft prospect Bailey cancels 76ers visit
content: Former Rutgers star Ace Bailey has canceled a visit to the Philadelphia 76ers, sources told ESPN, and has yet to visit any NBA teams ahead of next week's NBA draft.

title: Duchene sticks with Stars on 4-year, $18M deal
content: The Stars have reached a deal with one of their most notable pending free agents, re-signing forward Matt Duchene to a four-year contract worth $18 million.

title: Mbappé hospitalized with acute gastroenteritis
content: Real Madrid forward Kylian Mbappé is undergoing treatment for acute gastroenteritis, commonly known as the stomach flu.

title: Browns rookie Sanders cited for driving 101 mph
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders was cited by police early Tuesday morning for driving 101 mph in a 60 mph zone, according to police records.

title: Panthers damage Stanley Cup amid celebration
content: The Florida Panthers managed to crack and dent the Stanley Cup trophy within 24 hours of winning their second straight  championship.

title: 📈 MLB Power Rankings: Can anyone top Tigers?
content: With a third week in a row atop our list, Detroit becomes the team with the most consecutive weeks at No. 1 in 2025.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

title: Club World Cup updates, odds: Real Madrid draw shows scale of Alonso's task
content: Real Madrid's tournament began with a fizzle vs. Al Hilal, while Phil Foden fired Man City to an opening win over Wydad AC. Here's what you need to know as Wednesday unfolds in the Club World Cup.

content: Carlton Dotson is no longer behind bars, while a Baylor coaching whistleblower is now a prison warden

title: Wings' Bueckers finding her footing in rookie season of ups and downs
content: The No. 1 draft pick is looking increasingly confident and comfortable as a pro. Will it translate to more wins?

title: MLB mock draft 2.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first 40 picks
content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: Trade Giannis or build around him? 8 deals the Bucks should consider
content: Milwaukee could choose to retool its roster this summer. Will the two-time MVP still be a Buck when the dust settles?

title: The NBA draft talent pipeline (once again) runs through college basketball
content: After taking a backseat to other NBA developmental paths, college basketball seems to be reemerging at the top.

title: Updated NBA mock draft with movement in the top 10: How we see Rounds 1 and 2
content: With the draft a week away, Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo share the latest intel from around the league.

title: Premier League 2025-26 fixtures: Arsenal's horror start, all the big games
content: The fixtures for the 2025-26 Premier League season are out! Which title contenders have the toughest start and what could shape the race for the trophy?

title: Xabi says Madrid makeover 'a process' after draw
content: Xabi Alonso called for patience after Real Madrid's 1-1 draw with Al Hilal in their opening game at the Club World Cup, saying implementing the changes he wants to make "will take time."

title: Poch: USMNT not playing to get revenge on critics
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said he's not seeking vengeance against his critics after a positive start for the men's national team in the 2025 Gold Cup.

title: Alba returning, Messi fit as Miami faces Porto
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said Jordi Alba and Lionel Messi will both be available for selection Thursday in the team's second Club World Cup group stage match against FC Porto at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta.

title: Mudryk faces up to 4-year ban after doping charge
content: Mykhailo Mudryk is facing a potential ban of up to four years after the Football Association charged the Chelsea winger with a doping offence.

title: Juventus net five in commanding CWC opener
content: Randal Kolo Muani and Francisco Conceição both scored twice, leading Juventus to a dominant 5-0 victory over Al Ain in their Club World Cup debut in Washington, D.C. on Wednesday night.

title: Man Utd fans fume at 'eye-watering' ticket prices
content: Manchester United fans have hit out at the club for what they say are "eye-watering" ticket increases that are a "kick in the teeth" for supporters.

title: Laporta: Barça working on 'really exciting signing'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta says the Spanish champions are working on a "really exciting signing" after completing a deal to bring in Joan García.

title: Pep laments 'unnecessary' Lewis red in City win
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola described Rico Lewis' 88th-minute red card in Wednesday's 2-0 win over Wydad AC as an "unnecessary" decision by the referee.

title: How every team can qualify for quarterfinals
content: The group stage at the Concacaf Gold Cup is well underway, and here's what every country needs to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Euro 2025 breakout stars: Which U21 players will shine?
content: Euro 2025 will offer some young players the chance to shine, and there are a number of impressive U21 stars looking to do just that.

title: Fantasy football: Values for CMC, Tyreek and more top storylines for 2025
content: Mike Clay, Daniel Dopp and Field Yates enjoy a robust conversation about the topics that fascinate them most heading into this fantasy season.

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC Fight Night and PFL semifinals
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the main event for UFC from Azerbaijan, and Ian Parker provides betting advice for UFC and PFL events this week.

title: KPMG Women's PGA Championship: From Nelly Korda to Lydia Ko's record chase, storylines to watch
content: The third major of the LPGA Tour season starts Thursday with Korda looking to get back in the winner's circle and Ko trying to add to her impressive winnings.

title: Spaun's stunning U.S. Open victory shakes up Ryder Cup race, plus favorites at The Open
content: Who will be the favorites in The Open? Will J.J. Spaun's unlikely victory propel him to more wins? With the U.S. Open finished, we look ahead in the 2025 season.

title: Ignored for campaign, Tharoor's message to Cong: 'Strong bond with ... '
content: The Nilambur byelection's outcome could significantly influence the strained relationship between Congress and Shashi Tharoor, which has been tense since his praise for PM Modi. Tharoor acknowledged differences with party leadership while affirming his loyalty to Congress values and workers. A Congress victory without Tharoor might worsen the divide, whereas a loss could strengthen his position within the party.

title: Air India crash: Black box decoding location still undecided, says govt
content: Following the tragic Air India crash on June 12, 2025, that claimed approximately 270 lives, the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is leading the investigation. Both sets of the Dreamliner's black boxes, containing the Digital Flight Data Recorder (DFDR) and Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR), have been recovered.

title: Watch: Pak deputy PM admits asking for ceasefire after India struck 2 airbases
content: Pakistan's deputy PM Ishaq Dar admitted India's strikes on Nur Khan and Shorkot airbases during Operation Sindoor, retaliating for the Pahalgam attack. Carried out on May 6 and 7, the operation prompted Pakistan to seek Saudi intervention to halt further Indian action. The strikes targeted terror camps and infrastructure, delivering a strong message in response to the Pahalgam massacre.

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is forcing thousands of corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle, Arlington, and Washington DC. Employees receive 30 days to decide and 60 days to relocate or resign without severance. The mandate coincides with CEO Andy Jassy's warning that AI will shrink Amazon's workforce, potentially prompting voluntary departures as a cost-cutting measure.

title: IND vs ENG: 'He can bat all day like Dravid' - Ex-India cricketer lauds this batter
content: Mohammad Kaif supports Karun Nair's Test comeback, drawing parallels to Dravid, Laxman, and Pujara due to his red-ball temperament and consistency. Kaif also praises Sai Sudharsan's solid technique, envisioning him as a future Pujara or Dravid. For the fourth fast bowler slot, Kaif favors Nitish Reddy over Shardul Thakur, highlighting Reddy's batting prowess and recent red-ball performance.

title: Watch: Man in Jodhpur hides from police by dressing up as woman; arrested
content: Jodhpur police apprehended Daya Shankar, a wanted criminal, who attempted to evade capture by disguising himself as a woman. He was found wearing a saree, petticoat, and blouse. Social media was flooded with visuals of his arrest, showing him trying to conceal his face as police escorted him to the station, sparking varied reactions from online users.

title: Russia warns US against military action after Trump's 'may join' Israel remark
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, Russia cautioned the United States against military intervention, following Israeli strikes and Iranian retaliation. Despite a strategic partnership, Moscow hasn't offered military aid to Tehran, with Putin proposing mediation while condemning Israel. Putin and Xi Jinping jointly criticized Israel, advocating for a peaceful resolution.

title: Steve Jobs’ expensive gift: When Apple founder gifted Jaguar to secretary; said ‘don’t be…’
content: Steve Jobs, known for his demanding leadership, once gifted a late secretary a Jaguar to prevent future tardiness, showcasing his paradoxical nature of being both intimidating and inspiring. Ron Givens, Apple's former quality director, shared anecdotes of Jobs' unexpected generosity and relentless pursuit of excellence. Jobs' high expectations extended to late-night calls, as recalled by Pixar's Pete Docter.

title: IND vs ENG: Playing XI cues from the nets - Karun Nair likely to play in Leeds
content: Ahead of the first Test against England, Team India had an optional net session in Leeds. While key players like Pant and Bumrah skipped the session, Rahul, Jaiswal, and Gill had extensive practice. Karun Nair is likely to return to the Playing XI for the Headingley Test on Friday, June 20.

title: 'Didn't get a call from my family': Ashwin recalls emotional 500th wicket moment
content: Ravichandran Ashwin recounts the emotional rollercoaster surrounding his 500th Test wicket, achieved during the Rajkot Test against England. Amidst the celebrations, he had to rush back home due to his mother's illness, receiving immediate support from captain Rohit Sharma and coach Rahul Dravid. He rejoined the team later, showcasing his commitment to those who value him.

title: Intel layoffs: 10,000+ factory workers to be laid off; will they get any severance?
content: Intel is planning significant job cuts in its foundry division. The layoffs will affect thousands of employees globally. This decision is part of a larger restructuring effort led by CEO Lip-Bu Tan. The company aims to streamline operations and reduce costs. Intel has faced financial challenges and increased competition. Previous job cuts have already reduced the workforce.

title: Why the Karen Read trial became America's true-crime obsession
content: The Karen Read trial, a suburban tragedy turned national obsession, exposed the collision of American justice, media, and culture. Accused of murdering her boyfriend, a police officer, Read became a figure of intense public scrutiny, fueled by social media and dueling narratives. Ultimately acquitted, her case highlights the power of online opinion in shaping legal outcomes.

title: Israel pounds Iran: Ayatollah on the brink - will Khamenei’s regime implode?
content: Iran faces internal and external pressures. Israeli strikes eliminate key Iranian military figures. This exposes vulnerabilities. Khamenei's inner circle is weakened. Popular rage simmers. Khamenei's son consolidates power. Loyalty within the regime cracks. Military doctrine fails. The regime faces a historic crisis. It is a crisis of power and survival. The next week is crucial.

title: AI-171 crash: 'Aircraft, its engines showed no issues before flight,' says Air India CEO
content: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson affirmed that the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner involved in the June 12 crash was meticulously maintained. Enhanced pre-flight safety checks are now implemented across the 787 fleet, following a DGCA directive. Wilson stated that 26 of 33 aircraft have been cleared after inspections. A temporary reduction in widebody operations is a precautionary measure.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: 5 Assembly bypolls: High voter turnout in Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat, and Kerala
content: Bypolls across five Assembly segments in Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat, and Kerala saw varied voter turnouts, with West Bengal's Kaliganj leading at nearly 70%. Largely peaceful, the polls were necessitated by MLA deaths and resignations. Key contests included those in Nilambur (Kerala), Visavadar and Kadi (Gujarat), and Ludhiana West (Punjab). The Election Commission implemented webcasting and mobile-phone deposit facilities.

title: Dwyane Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shows support for Victoria Monét in heartfelt post
content: Gabrielle Union is set to moderate Victoria Monét's book launch event in Los Angeles for her new children's book, 'Everywhere You Are.' Union reposted Monét's announcement on Instagram, expressing her support for the book, which explores themes of love and connection. The event promises a discussion and Q&A session, with both mothers and authors sharing their insights.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: IND vs ENG: How to bat in England? Tendulkar shares tips for Indian batting
content: Sachin Tendulkar, whose name now features on the England-India Test series trophy alongside Jimmy Anderson, shared insights on India’s inexperienced batting unit, the Bazball challenge, and the England seamer's legacy. He urged India to focus on winning sessions as the Test series begins at Headingley on June 20. The Master Blaster also reflected on cricket's evolution and explained what made Anderson special.

title: IND vs ENG: Can Bazball outplay India's new era? Key battles and what to expect
content: England's 'Bazball' approach faces its ultimate test in a five-Test series against India. While the aggressive strategy has brought success, vulnerabilities remain, including over-reliance on Joe Root, an inexperienced bowling attack post-Anderson and Broad, and a still-unsettled spin department. India's seasoned players and diverse attack will probe these weaknesses, questioning whether England can adapt when their high-risk philosophy is challenged.

title: India bleeds Pak dry: Water at ‘dead’ levels; bigger Indus plans - top points
content: Following the Indus Waters Treaty suspension, India is optimizing the Indus river system, looking to construct a 113-km canal to redirect water to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This inter-basin transfer aims to maximize water usage from eastern rivers and fully utilize India's share of western rivers, potentially limiting Pakistan's water access.

title: 'Will evacuate Indians who wish to leave Israel,' says MEA- check details
content: Amidst the escalating Iran-Israel crisis, the Indian government has decided to evacuate Indian nationals from Israel who wish to return. Travel will be facilitated via land borders and then by air to India. Registration details and contact information for the Indian Embassy in Tel Aviv have been provided for assistance.

title: IND vs ENG: Cook's big statement on Virat-Rohit exit - 'Now there's a clean slate ...'
content: Former England skipper Alastair Cook observes that Virat Kohli and captain Rohit Sharma's Test retirements mark a significant shift in India's dressing room dynamics, creating a 'clean slate' for new leadership under Shubman Gill. Despite their recent form decline, Kohli and Sharma's absence removes unchallenged authority, potentially impacting team culture.

title: Five-time Pro Bowl linebacker CJ Mosley retires from NFL
content: C.J. Mosley, the former Baltimore Ravens standout and New York Jets defensive leader, has retired after a decade in the NFL. Drafted by Baltimore in 2014, Mosley earned four Pro Bowls before joining the Jets in 2019. Despite injuries, he anchored New York's defense, amassing over 1,000 tackles and showcasing exceptional leadership throughout his career.

title: India kicks off much-needed review of arms procurement procedures
content: India has initiated a comprehensive review of its Defence Acquisition Procedure 2020 to expedite weapon system procurement, promote self-reliance, and increase private sector involvement. The review aims to streamline processes, align with 'Atmanirbharta' goals, and encourage indigenous technology infusion.

title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut – How past Indian skippers fared
content: Shubman Gill, at 25, is set to captain India in Test cricket for the first time against England at Headingley. The article revisits the debut Test matches of previous Indian captains, highlighting their varied experiences. From Kohli's aggressive start with centuries to Ganguly's commanding win, each leader carved a unique path.

title: ‘City killer’ asteroid may hit the Moon in Dec 2032 could threaten satellites around Earth
content: Asteroid 2024 YR4, though not an Earth threat, now poses a collision risk to the Moon. Scientists estimate a 4.3% chance of impact, potentially ejecting 100 million kilograms of lunar debris into space. This debris could endanger satellites in low Earth orbit, crucial for communication, GPS, and climate monitoring, necessitating international attention and preparedness.

title: Who is Sophie Cunningham? Viral WNBA moment shows her fierce defense of Caitlin Clark
content: In a WNBA game, Sophie Cunningham defended Caitlin Clark after a foul. Cunningham's action led to her ejection and went viral. Fans praised her, and her jersey sales surged. Cunningham, known for her defense, became a fan favorite. The Fever won the game. Now, Cunningham is recognized as 'The Enforcer'. Everyone is watching her support for Clark.

title: Deja vu diplomacy: Why Trump's Iran gamble feels like Bush's worst mistake
content: Now, in 2025, Trumpworld believes a single strike on Fordo — Iran’s heavily fortified nuclear site — will miraculously solve the nuclear crisis. Supporters like John Bolton urge, “Bomb Fordo and be done with it,” echoing the casual fatalism of Iraq’s early architects. Tulsi Gabbard, now Director of National Intelligence, has said Iran isn't actively building a bomb. Trump’s response? “I don’t care what she said.”

title: Mumbai: Rs 25 crore worth of hydroponic weed seized at airport; 3 arrested
content: Mumbai airport customs seized hydroponic weed worth approximately Rs 25 crore. Officials arrested three individuals. Coimbatore airport officials previously seized 5.25kg of hydroponic weed worth Rs 5 crore. A Kerala native was arrested for smuggling from Bangkok. Hydroponic ganja has a high THC content, making it potent. NCB notes its limited prevalence compared to synthetic drugs.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: Sanjay Verma under scanner, cops probe 200+ calls with Sonam
content: The murder of businessman Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya takes a twist with the emergence of 'Sanjay Verma,' a possible alias used by Sonam Raghuvanshi's alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha. Police are investigating a potential financial motive linked to a major contract Raja secured. Reenactment of the crime revealed a second weapon and Sonam's presence during the attack.

title: 'Created to build nukes': IDF gives closer look at nuclear reactor in Iran- watch
content: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) released a video claiming Iran was using the Arak nuclear reactor to develop nuclear weapons, stating it neutralized the reactor in a recent attack. Iranian state TV confirmed the attack, noting the site was evacuated beforehand, posing no radiation threat. This action retaliated against Iran's strike on an Israeli hospital.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill plays cards close to his chest on India XI; reveals speaking to Rohit, Virat
content: Shubman Gill, the new Test captain, expressed his honour at leading India and confirmed he would bat at No.4, filling Virat Kohli's spot. He emphasized creating a secure team environment and backing young players. While keeping the playing XI flexible based on pitch conditions, Gill hinted at an evolving team identity to be revealed later in the series.

title: SC panel proposes impeachment of Justice Varma - What probe report said
content: A high court judge, Yashwant Varma, faces potential impeachment after an inquiry found him and his family had control over a store room where burnt cash was discovered. The inquiry committee, led by Chief Justice Sheel Nagu, found serious misconduct, leading to a recommendation for Justice Varma's removal by former CJI Sanjiv Khanna.

title: Paulina Gretzky shares rare family moment on son River’s birthday
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and wife of golfer Dustin Johnson, recently gave fans a peek into her family life with a heartfelt Instagram post celebrating her younger son River’s 7th birthday. The image revealed a stylish yet intimate setting. This underscores the couple’s deep commitment to parenting amid fame.

title: Who is Karen Read? Boston woman acquitted of murdering cop boyfriend in 2022
content: Karen Read was acquitted of murder and manslaughter in the death of her boyfriend, Boston police officer John O'Keefe, but found guilty of OUI. The verdict, delivered after a retrial, sparked contrasting reactions, with Read's supporters celebrating and O'Keefe's family decrying a miscarriage of justice.

title: Shots fired near Tejashwi Yadav’s house in Patna
content: In Patna, just a day before Prime Minister Modi's visit to Bihar, gunfire erupted in a high-security zone near the residences of top officials, including the Chief Minister and Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav. Two assailants on a motorcycle opened fire, prompting a police investigation and raising concerns about security.

title: Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy: India–England series enters new era, tribute to legends
content: In a historic move, the BCCI and ECB have announced the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy, replacing the Pataudi and Anthony De Mello Trophies, for Test series between India and England. This new title honours James Anderson and Sachin Tendulkar, celebrating their immense contributions to cricket.

title: Delhi schools rise in rankings: 44-point jump in PGI 2.0; What drove the big score boost?
content: Delhi has improved its Performance Grading Index (PGI) score by 44 points, moving from Akanshi-1 to Prachesta-3 in the 2023–24 evaluation released by the Ministry of Education. The capital made notable gains in infrastructure and governance, while maintaining strong performance in equity. However, learning outcomes and access showed limited improvement. Delhi’s progress reflects broader national trends, with 24 states and UTs improving their PGI scores, though only Chandigarh reached the Prachesta-1 grade.

title: 11 surprising stats that have defined the 2025 MLB season
content: From Aaron Judge chasing Ty Cobb(!) to the greatest season by a catcher ever, a look at some big-time big-league numbers.

title: First Betts, now Devers? Red Sox ownership under fire from fans -- again
content: John Henry & Co. traded another franchise icon. The only thing they can do to appease the Fenway faithful now? Win.

title: Fantasy baseball: Crow-Armstrong slumps hard? Boston's DH bests Stanton? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea explore move for Kudus
content: Chelsea are interested in signing West Ham midfielder Mohammed Kudus. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: Trump questions Juventus on women in men’s team; players exchange awkward glances
content: During a White House visit, Juventus players and staff faced an awkward situation when Donald Trump steered their ceremonial event into a political discussion. He questioned the team about transgender athletes in women's sports, following a Supreme Court ruling on gender-affirming care. Trump's focus on this issue aligns with his second-term agenda, including policies restricting transgender participation in women's sports.

title: India seeking trade deals with rich, democratic countries: Goyal
content: Fifteen years ago, we were more focused on doing trade agreements with countries who are our competitors, he says.

title: In U.K., Goyal slams Opposition for criticising Indian government overseas
content: The Minister commended the U.K. Labour Party for not backtracking on any commitments regarding the trade deal made to the Indian side by the previous Conservative Party government.

title: Congress sets up five-member panel to probe alleged rise in crimes against women in BJP-ruled Odisha
content: The move follows a gang rape incident in Gopalpur, where a college girl was attacked by a group of 10 men while she was at the beach during the Raj Parv festival

title: SWR saves ₹4 cr. by generating 6.72 million units of power harnessing solar energy
content: According to officials, this aligns with Indian Railways’ mission to become the world’s first 100% green railway network by 2030

title: ASI to host three-day international conclave in August on decoding Indus Valley script
content: Move comes months after Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin announced $1 million prize for experts or organisations that succeed in deciphering the script

title: Maharashtra to establish Shahir Sable research centre for experimental arts
content: The centre will be named after the legendary Marathi folk artist Shahir Krishnarao Sable, renowned for his iconic song Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha — officially recognised as the state song in 2023.

title: Dayanidhi Maran sends legal notice to brother Kalanithi Maran raising dispute in Sun TV share transactions
content: The notice pointed that from the inception of Sun TV Network Ltd (earlier Sumangali Publications Pvt Ltd) till September 15, 2003, Mr. Kalanithi had served solely as an employee of the group receiving salary and did not hold any shares

title: Footwear hurled at West Bengal BJP president, Sikhs protests outside party office
content: A few days ago, the BJP leader had hurled a poster with a pair of slippers printed on it, which fell on a turban-clad police officer

title: BJP accuses Trinamool of ‘booth jam, rigging’ in Kaliganj bypoll; voting continues amidst rain
content: Bye-election in Kaliganj was necessitated after the passing of Trinamool Congress MLA Nasiruddin Ahmed on February 2. As of 5 p.m., EC officials pegged the turnout at nearly 70%

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: Police custody for slain Indore man’s wife extended
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi and her alleged lover Raj Singh Kushwaha are accused of murdering Sonam’s husband near a cascade in Meghalaya’s Sohra on May 23

title: BCI hits back at Society of Indian Law Firms over foreign law firm rules
content: Responding to SILF’s public statements on allowing foreign law firms to work in India, the BCI — the regulatory authority for the legal profession — said the group does not speak for most Indian law firms, especially smaller and newer ones

title:
A novel that captures the reconversion
of Catholic fishermen to Hinduism
content: It is rare to see a temple in front of a church, especially in Tamil Nadu’s southern coast where the entire fishermen community converted to Catholicism centuries ago. The Siddhi Vinayagar Temple at Idinthakarai in Tirunelveli district is the result of a tumultuous history, which is vividly told in the novel Alaivaikaraiyil by Rajam Krishnan

title: Canada-based Khalistani extremists continue to plan, fund violence in India, says report
content: A day after Modi-Carney reset ties, official Canadian government report doubles down on Nijjar killing allegations

title: Political fallout that unfolded after the brutal killing of EPRLF leaders
content: The massacre of K. Padmanabha and others in Chennai in 1990 paved the way for the Karunanidhi government to be dismissed. It also delivered a body blow to EPRLF, which was the main opponent of the LTTE. EPRLF is now a political party in Sri Lanka

title: Three missing after boat sinks in Assam
content: More than 100 people, including schoolchildren, were on the motorised boat that sank partially in a tributary of the Brahmaputra in the Nalbari district

title: Madurai women staged the first recorded strike in the cotton mills of South India
content: Madura Mills was established in the temple town by 1892. About 28 years later, nearly 750 women workers went on a strike against patriarchal practices at the workplace. Among the other reasons for the strike was maistri Guruswami Naidu obstructing the formation of a women’s labour union, says a report published in The Hindu

title: X writes to Manjul about cartoons on Mamata Banerjee posted six years ago
content: ‘What harm can a cartoon do?’ the acclaimed artist asked; he said the backlash against his work had increased in the past decade

title: 'India's Hypersonic Glide Missile Is In Advanced Stage': DRDO Chief To NDTV
content: Indian weapons systems were a success during Operation Sindoor when India struck Pakistan during its 100-hour aerial battle, damaging enemy airfields, drones, and air defence systems.

title: Delhi Metro To Begin Services From 4 AM On International Yoga Day
content: In order to facilitate the movement of Yoga Enthusiasts on the occasion of international Yoga Day, the Delhi Metro services will commence from 4 AM from all originating stations on June 21, an official statement said.

title: Trump Extends Deadline To Sell TikTok To Non-Chinese Buyer In US By 90 Days
content: President Donald Trump announced Thursday he had given social media platform TikTok another 90 days to find a non-Chinese buyer or be banned in the United States.

title: Web Casting Done At All Except 1 Booth In 5 Assembly Bypolls: Poll Body
content: Webcasting was done at all but one polling station of the five Assembly seats that went to bypolls on Thursday, the Election Commission said.

title: Air India To Cut Flights On 16 International Routes, Suspend Ops To 3 Cities
content: Air India on Thursday said flights will be reduced on 16 international routes and suspended on 3 overseas destinations between June 21 and July 15.

title: On Camera, Rider, Woman Die After Speeding Ducati Plunges Into Pit In Greater Noida
content: A 28-year-old man and his friend, 25, were killed when he lost control of a Ducati bike and it careened into a wall of barricades before plunging into a pit in Greater Noida.

title: "Let's Collaborate Deeply": Pranav Adani As Chintan Research Foundation Celebrates 1st Foundation Day
content: Chintan Research Foundation (CRF), the think tank of the Adani Group, celebrated its first Foundation Day on Thursday in Delhi.

title: Netanyahu Thanks "Friend Of Israel" Trump For Iran War "Support": 10 Points
content: The Iran Military has confirmed in a statement on Telegram that it has begun a "new round of combined missile and drone attacks" on military sites in Haifa and Tel Aviv.

title: Meitei Farmer Injured In Shooting By Suspected "Kuki Insurgents", Kuki Woman Killed In Crossfire With Security Forces
content: An elderly farmer from the Meitei community was shot at by suspected insurgents in Manipur's Bishnupur district today, sources told NDTV. The incident happened at 3 pm in a paddy field in Phubala village, they said.

title: Bangladesh Declares National Holiday To Mark Year Of Sheikh Hasina Ouster
content: August 5 will mark a year since the ouster of the Sheikh Hasina government in Bangladesh. To mark the event, the interim government has decided to observe the day as Student-People's Uprising Day and declare it a nationwide public holiday.

title: Only 12% Women In Real Estate, National Council Aims To Bridge Gap
content: India's growing real estate sector, which is reportedly projected to reach $1 trillion by 2030, is seeing gradual growth in the participation of women. However, they currently only comprise 11-12% of the workforce.

title: IIT Graduate Among 15 'Online Sexual Predators' Arrested In Telangana
content: In a major crackdown on online child sexual predators, the Telangana Cyber Security Bureau has arrested 15 people, mostly educated men in their 20s.

title: Indian Money In Swiss Banks Triples On Banking Funds, Highest Since 2021
content: Indian money parked in Swiss banks more than tripled in 2024 to 3.5 billion Swiss francs on the back of a huge jump in funds held through local branches and financial institutions, annual data released by Switzerland's central bank showed.

title: 18-Month-Old Child Injured In Accident Between Audi, Bike In Delhi: Cops
content: An 18-month-old child was injured due to an accident between an Audi car and a motorcyle in southeast Delhi's Hazrat Nizamuddin area on Thursday, an official said.

title: Bypolls For 5 Seats In 4 States Largely Peaceful, High Turnout In Bengal
content: Bypolls were held in five Assembly segments across Punjab, West Bengal, Gujarat and Kerala on Thursday, with the Kaliganj seat in West Bengal registering a polling percentage of nearly 70 by 5 pm.

title: Macron Shares PM Modi's "Fighting On Twitter" Viral Joke
content: French President Emmanuel Macron has shared a montage of his meetings with world leaders including Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the G7 Summit which took place in Canada's Kananaskis.

title: Aviation Watchdog Warns Air India Over 3 Planes, Says Checks Overdue: Report
content: India's aviation regulator has warned Air India for breaching safety rules after three of its Airbus planes flew despite being overdue checks on emergency equipment, and for being slow to address the issue, government documents show.

title: Loyal To Congress For 16 Years, Differences Can Be Discussed: Shashi Tharoor
content: Congress's Shashi Tharoor, whose difference of opinion with many of his party leaders over multiple issues has been highlighted in the media over the recent months, played it down today.

title: Drunk Man Climbs Mobile Tower In Karnataka Over Marriage, Property Dispute: Cops
content: In a scene straight out of a film, a 26-year-old drunk man climbed atop a telecom tower in Vijayapura in Karnataka, and refused to climb down due to a family dispute over marriage and property.

title: Amazon To Invest $233 Million In India To Expand Infrastructure, Improve Tech
content: Amazon will invest more than 20 billion rupees ($233 million) in India in 2025 to expand and update its operations infrastructure, develop new technology for its fulfilment network and improve delivery safety, it said on Thursday.

title: Devise framework for rehabilitation of bereaved survivors of industrial accidents in Tamil Nadu: Madras High Court
content: The court observes that the repeated pattern of accidents — 131 deaths and 146 serious injuries between 2019 and 2023 in the region — only suggests a chronic absence of inspection, enforcement, and accountability

title: Arappor Iyakkam asks CM to terminate paddy transportation tenders
content: The organisation demanded that the tender contract, filled with illegalities to unjustly enrich the contractor, be terminated immediately

title: Stronger Port State Control regime to ensure safety of ships  called for
content: Back-to-back ship accidents off the coast of Kerala raise   questions on the lax regulatory inspections being carried out by different agencies  on ships. PSC regime envisions identifying substandard ships at any port in India and ensuring seaworthiness before the vessels are allowed to sail out of the port

title: ICMR sets up high performing computing facility to boost genomic surveillance and pandemic preparedness
content: NAKSHATRA facility to boost genomic storage and analysis, aiding faster detection of new disease threats, more efficient response to outbreaks, accelerating AI-driven vaccine and drug development

title: CM calls for grand celebration of International Yoga Day event in Visakhapatnam on June 21
content: State aims to achieve two Guinness World Records and a total of 22 world records through the initiative, says Chandrababu Naidu

title: Reading is alive, it has just changed with the times: CM
content: Instead of physical books, people now made use of digital platforms and podcasts, says CM, inaugurating the Reading Day celebrations of the P.N. Panicker Foundation

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Air India CEO says crashed Dreamliner was well-maintained, undergone last major check in June 2023
content: While DGCA raised concerns over recent maintenance-related issues at Air India and directed airline to boost inter-department coordination, it said that the surveillance of the airline’s Boeing 787 fleet did not reveal any major safety concerns in the wake of the fatal plane crash in Ahmedabad last week

title: Mother cannot seek cancellation of gift deed executed by father or vice-versa, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh also holds that gift deeds cannot be cancelled if they do not explicitly impose a condition to take care of the aged parents

title: Crowd control Bill proposes to auction property of event planner for denial of compensation to injured, dead
content: The State Cabinet discussed drafts of the Karnataka Crowd Control (Managing Crowd at Events and Venues of Mass Gathering) Bill 2025, and three other Bills

title: U.K. fighter jet’s departure to be delayed further
content: British authorities have sought more time and a Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul facility to fix the technical glitches the aircraft sustained during an emergency landing in the Thiruvananthapuram airport on June 14. The fighter jet could not return to the aircraft carrier because of inclement weather and it was running low on fuel

title: Bypolls: Voting concludes in five Assembly constituencies in four States
content: Polling took place at the Assembly Constituencies of Kadi (SC) and Visavadar in Gujarat, Nilambur in Kerala, Ludhiana West in Punjab and Kaliganj in West Bengal

title: National award for literary illustration in memory of artist Namboodiri
content: The aim of the award is to recognise outstanding artists working in the realm of literary illustration across all Indian languages.

title: Telangana raising unnecessary hue and cry over Banakacherla project, says Naidu
content: The idea is to utilise the Godavari water going waste into the sea, Telangana was also free to utilise such waters, says CM

title: Notice to Bihar Chief Secretary, DGP over Lalu’s ‘insult’ to Ambedkar
content: This comes a week after visuals emerged of the Rashtriya Janata Dal chief celebrating his birthday on June 11, during which a portrait of Dr. Ambedkar was purportedly seen being placed near his feet.

title: CM Naidu failed to deliver promises, resorting to politics of diversion, alleges Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: YSRCP will release a QR Code-based website in the name of ‘Recalling of CBN Manifesto’ where all the poll promises of NDA will be mentioned, says party chief

title: Kerala HC defers negotiation initiated by State with MSC on compensation for damage due to sinking of container ship
content: Special Secretary (Department of Environment) has been appointed as the Principal Impact Assessment Officer. Decision made to take steps under the Environment Protection Act

title: Disability-related questions in Census must be framed differently, say rights groups
content: Only a fraction of PwD population has been captured in past Censuses, says Nipman Foundation; says better questions, accessible formats, training needed; seeks time to make suggestions to ORGI

title: Overflowing sewage raises a stink at Durgam Cheruvu
content: A nala on northern side of lake and six storm water drains connected to it have been identified as the source of sewage flowing into the lake

title: Two more cases registered against couple under POCSO Act in Kozhikode
content: Police to record statements of more teenagers who were allegedly drugged and sexually exploited by the two

title: ₹30-crore master plan to create facilities at Vayalur Murugan temple ready
content: HR&CE department has proposed to take up construction of a tonsure block, provision of a spacious parking lot, toilets block, annadhana koodam, and construction of a one-lakh litre overhead water tank

title: Excess production of Totapuri mangoes leaves farmers, factory units high and dry
content: Notwithstanding the district administration’s assurance to procure even the last harvested mango, the farmers reportedly are indulging in panic harvest and as a result, the price of the fruit has further plummeted

title: Newborn being treated for spinal muscular atrophy before symptoms set in
content: Baby was found carrying the SMN1 gene mutation for the ailment through prenatal genetic screening and is being treated with a rare disease-modifying drug at SAT Hospital, since early treatment tends to provide more benefits. The mother is an SMA patient

title: Green Tourism Circuit in Pala awaits take off
content: Administrative sanction for the ₹145-crore project that aims at boosting domestic tourism and pilgrimage in the eastern high ranges of Kottayam district was received in 2013

title: Bill Clinton on Middle East crisis: Netanyahu wants to stay in office forever
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs .

title: Five takeaways from J.J. McCarthy's offseason as Vikings' expected starting QB
content: the world has no shortage of opinions on quarterback J.J. McCarthy . he's not ready to lead the Vikings to super bowl lX in february . "they've really pushed the limits on just what I can handle," he says .

title: College football's most unbreakable records, from Barry Sanders to Bobby Bowden
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams
content: Boca Juniors fans get ready for the club world cup with chants and drums on Miami beach . the tournament feels unmistakably South American, but in the u.s. it's a global tournament . many of their UEFA counterparts shrug with apathy at the expanded tournament, noting its lack of history .

title: Why the Panthers are the nicest 'rats' to win the Stanley Cup (twice)
content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Edmonton Oilers 5-1 to become back-to-back Stanley Cup champions . they're the most antagonistic trash-talking bullies in the national hockey league . opponents decry their actions and fans outright loathe them .

title: How the Thunder win it all and the Pacers force Game 7
content: Shams Charania and Brian Windhorst break down what Tyrese Haliburton could mean for the Pacers heading into game 6 . the 2025 finals are one step closer to crowning a new champion . a strained right calf and will undergo an MRI .

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: 16 nations will compete at euro 2025 in Switzerland for the chance to be crowned european champions . the stakes are higher than ever, with prize money more than doubled compared with the previous tournament . each federation receives at least €1.8 million and required to allocate at least 30% to players .
